meanings.definition: In a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: She tried to juggle the balls unhandily, causing them to fall to the ground.
meanings.sent2: He walked unhandily in the dark, bumping into furniture along the way.
meanings.sent3: The robot danced unhandily, amusing the audience with its robotic moves.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved unhandily over the piano keys, producing a discordant melody.
meanings.sent5: The toddler attempted to draw a straight line unhandily, creating a squiggly masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The unhandily wrapped gift kept falling apart as she tried to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The unhandily written note was barely legible, with words scribbled all over.
meanings.sent3: The unhandily folded paper airplane refused to fly straight, causing laughter among the kids.
meanings.sent4: His unhandily tied shoelaces kept coming undone, making him trip often.
meanings.sent5: The unhandily stacked books teetered on the edge of the shelf, ready to topple over.
